text: The demographics of Pakistan and India are very similar . Poverty is a widespread issue . According to the FAO , 40 percent of children in Pakistan are malnourished and underweight due to lack of access to adequate food . And this is not because there is n't enough ; Pakistan is the 8th largest food producing country , however , 50 percent of the population is food insecure . With the massive income inequality that persists , RHA is a brilliant movement . We collect leftover or extra food from restaurants and distribute it to the homeless and hungry in the locality .
reworded: The demographics of Pakistan and India are quite alike, and poverty remains a significant challenge. The FAO reports that 40 percent of children in Pakistan suffer from malnutrition and are underweight due to insufficient access to proper food. This situation is not due to a lack of food, as Pakistan ranks as the 8th largest food producer; however, 50 percent of the population still experiences food insecurity. Given the severe income inequality that exists, the RHA initiative is commendable. We gather surplus or leftover food from restaurants and distribute it to the homeless and those in need within the community.

text: This is the rhetoric of what anthropologist Laura Agust ? n calls the " rescue industry " - a term used to describe people and institutions who conceptualize all sex workers as victims in need of saving . text: It is understandable to want to protect one 's home and family from the conflict , but we must rally together as humans , understanding that we have a responsibility to help the world 's most vulnerable to survive and rebuild their lives . There are hundreds of thousands of refugees who want nothing more than a safe place for themselves and their families . They travel under incredibly dangerous circumstances to avoid having to live in places ravaged by war and terror . Their suffering is something that we should all understand . The countries neighboring Syria such as Jordan , Lebanon , Turkey and Iraq have already taken in millions of people and can take no more .
reworded: It’s completely natural to want to safeguard one’s home and family from conflict, but we must unite as human beings, recognizing our duty to assist the world’s most vulnerable in surviving and rebuilding their lives. There are countless refugees seeking nothing more than safety for themselves and their families. They endure perilous journeys to escape living in war-torn and terror-stricken areas. Their pain is something we should all empathize with. Neighboring countries like Jordan, Lebanon, Turkey, and Iraq have already welcomed millions of people and are now at their limit.

text: Smyth told HKFP : " The biggest challenge is the no work policy . I think that refugees who come here , or asylum seekers , they 're unable to work and they have kids here -- their kids are stateless . That 's really the cause of a lot of stress in the community . "
reworded: Smyth expressed to HKFP, "The primary challenge is the no-work policy. Refugees and asylum seekers who arrive here are unable to find employment, and many have children who are stateless. This situation is a significant source of stress within the community."

text: The growing black middle class , , amongst other things , owes its success to the educational opportunities provided by our government . Some of the new black professional and middle classes were from poor families and from within the ranks of the working class . We need to be proud of all these achievements as the country celebrates 20 years of democracy .
reworded: The expanding black middle class owes much of its success to the educational opportunities made available by our government. Many individuals in the new black professional and middle classes come from low-income backgrounds and working-class families. As the nation marks 20 years of democracy, we should take pride in these accomplishments.

text: Why is the voting turn-out so poor in rich countries like America , whose GDP may be high but which still has a vast majority of homeless and poor people ? Democracy is not the solution to everything and most countries still do not practice democracy to its full meaning . Poor countries need to show they are democratic to play the field in globalisation and modernisation and get their poor to the voting pool , who would in many cases much rather just be working on their fields as politicians never really did much for them anyway .
reworded: What accounts for the low voter turnout in wealthy nations like America, which, despite having a high GDP, still harbors a significant number of homeless and impoverished individuals? Democracy doesn’t solve every problem, and many countries still fail to fully embrace its principles. For poorer nations, demonstrating democratic practices is essential to engage in globalization and modernization, and to encourage their underprivileged citizens to participate in elections, who often prefer to focus on their farming rather than voting, since politicians have historically done little to improve their circumstances.

text: He would n't tolerate nonsense and he never allowed anybody to intimidate him . He was wealthy and very comfortable , and with his wealth was very generous and kind . He used to tell us that being comfortable did not mean we were special , as God had created everyone equally .
reworded: He wouldn't put up with any nonsense and never let anyone intimidate him. He was affluent and very comfortable, and he was also quite generous and kind with his wealth. He often reminded us that being comfortable didn’t make us special, as God created everyone equally.

text: The common thieves then stole a crust of bread , the law came down upon the hungry heads ; the haughty land robber stole land with men resources and all contents . The first they said were a hopeless conviction . While they escaped the law by trick ; that grave , one-sided justice would not do -- the poor call for consideration , too . The cruel people started the unholy war , then from the line of action they kept far ; they pushed to the front sons of the poor , there to do battle , die , suffer galore , as the guns raged , liberty loans they raised , and in glorious tones , we sung freedom 's praise . Those who made wars should first went to the front , and of shot and shell bear there the brunt : In first lines of action they were all due , if to their country and people they were true : When this was demanded in right of all , there would have been no more deadly cannon balls : The downtrodden poor people of us joined together and prevented the Pakistani rulers our rights to purloin .
reworded: The common thieves took a piece of bread, while the law came down hard on the hungry; meanwhile, the arrogant land robbers seized land along with its resources and everything else. The former were deemed a lost cause, while the latter evaded justice through deceit. This unjust, one-sided legal system was inadequate—the impoverished demanded consideration as well. The cruel instigators of the unjust war kept their distance from the frontline; instead, they sent the sons of the poor to fight, suffer, and die in battle, all while raising liberty loans and singing praises of freedom. Those who instigated wars should have been the first to face the dangers of combat, bearing the brunt of the violence themselves. If they were truly loyal to their country and its people, they should have led the charge. Had this been the case, there would have been no need for deadly cannon fire. The oppressed among us united to prevent the Pakistani rulers from stealing our rights.

text: " With your impeccable personal dignity , you elevated the Office of Secretary-General in a manner rarely seen . reworded: "Your outstanding personal integrity has significantly enhanced the role of Secretary-General in a way that is seldom witnessed. With unmatched diplomatic expertise and great effectiveness, you have harnessed the influence of your position to advocate for global peace and safeguard those in need. In doing so, you have elevated both the United Nations and Ghana to unprecedented levels on the world stage." - Michael Kingsley-Nyinah, DPKO, New York.

text: Part of the result now is the massive exodus of Africans from the continent to seek greener pastures in Europe . It is sad to see scores of young people die trying to cross the Sahara and Mediterranean into paradise . It is sad when our televisions show hundreds of immigrants trapped between the sea and fenced territories in Europe because they can not enter . What are they fleeing from ; why ca n't they stay at home ? This indeed is a million dollar question . They are fleeing from mismanaged economies that could have otherwise done well ; they are fleeing from years of bad politicking which has given birth to some of the worst policies the world has ever known .
reworded: A significant outcome of the current situation is the large-scale migration of Africans seeking better opportunities in Europe. It is heartbreaking to witness numerous young individuals perish while attempting to traverse the Sahara and Mediterranean in search of a better life. It’s distressing to see images on our screens of countless immigrants caught between the sea and fenced borders in Europe, unable to gain entry. What drives them to leave their homes? Why can’t they remain where they are? This is indeed a pressing question. They are escaping from poorly managed economies that had the potential to thrive; they are fleeing years of ineffective governance that has led to some of the most detrimental policies seen globally.

text: Finally , there seems to be a ray of hope for the poor and the vulnerable in Nigeria 's rural communities as far as health care services are concerned . reworded: At last, there appears to be a glimmer of hope for the impoverished and vulnerable populations in Nigeria's rural areas regarding healthcare services. It is estimated that about 70 percent of Nigeria's population residing in these rural regions faces a greater burden of disease, lower income levels, and a pressing need for support.

text: I have a dream journal . Sometimes , I create ads from dreams . Yellow Man for DiGi being one of them . Is that considered weird ? I 've also dressed up as a homeless man for a shoot once , but decided to stay like that for a few more hours after experiencing being ignored and feeling invisible . It was an eye opener .

text: These unfortunately reach limited numbers because budgets have of necessity to be restricted . In our culture, we observe a tradition of providing meals as alms to those in residential care and giving gifts to individuals on our birthdays and in memory of our deceased loved ones. Both the state and society view these individuals as requiring 'social services,' which are often equated with 'charity.' This has been the reality in Sri Lanka for many years. People with disabilities rely on acts of goodwill and charity.

text: The European Union together with its Member States is the world 's leading donor of humanitarian aid . Relief assistance is an expression of European solidarity towards people in need around the world . It aims to save lives , prevent and alleviate human suffering , and safeguard the integrity and human dignity of populations affected by natural disasters and man-made crises . For more information , please visit ECHO 's website .
reworded: The European Union, along with its Member States, stands as the foremost global contributor of humanitarian aid. This assistance reflects European solidarity with those in need worldwide. Its purpose is to save lives, alleviate human suffering, and uphold the dignity and integrity of communities affected by both natural disasters and human-made crises. For further details, please visit ECHO's website.

text: This discarded corpse , latterly a boy who had been taught to sing about being " a bundle of potentiality " , she says , was erratic in school attendance and behaviour , most often hungry and unkempt and demonstrably lacking in affirmation and attention at home , foisted on teachers , who , obsessed with curriculum , hopefully willing but hopelessly ill-equipped to save him from his ( and our ) final resting place .
reworded: This abandoned body, once a boy who had been encouraged to sing about being "a bundle of potentiality," she notes, exhibited inconsistent school attendance and behavior, frequently appeared hungry and disheveled, and clearly lacked affirmation and attention at home. He was left to the care of teachers who, preoccupied with the curriculum, were well-meaning yet tragically unprepared to rescue him from his (and our) inevitable fate.

text: The coming fury of angry America is as palpable as it is silent . What will that tiny part of a tiny part of the earth 's population do when the utter hopelessness of the situation washes over them and the tides of history curl around and bear them , inexorably , into the past ?
reworded: The impending wrath of an aggrieved America is as evident as it is unspoken. How will that minuscule segment of the global population react when the overwhelming despair of their circumstances envelops them, and the currents of history inevitably pull them into the past?

text: While traversing various communities in Jamaica , one can see the hopelessness on the faces of many of our youth . text: Women are generally not as competitive as men , and not as motivated by job prestige . We want to actualise but not necessarily in the same ways as men . reworded: Women typically exhibit less competitiveness than men and are not as driven by job prestige. They seek fulfillment but often in different ways than men do. text: The African continent is increasingly becoming the global common hub for doing business . Africa 's economic structural reforms have shown a strong resilient following the global economic crisis in 2008 by rebounding back very quickly since the last decade and going forward , looking more robust .
reworded: The African continent is increasingly establishing itself as a central hub for global business. Once labeled as a 'hopeless continent,' Africa has overcome numerous challenges to reveal its true potential. It is not only drawing the attention of the world but is also gaining support from local operators within Africa. The continent's economic structural reforms have demonstrated remarkable resilience following the global financial crisis of 2008, recovering swiftly over the past decade and appearing more robust as it moves forward.

text: All of this is done to help raise money for Gordy and Eva Hoffman 's three charities : Project Warmth , Alberta Champions , ( for the purpose of full disclosure , I 'm on the board ) and Operation Kickstart . This year , Project Warmth will distribute more than 85,000 pieces of gently used and cleaned coats , hats and gloves to needy children . Alberta Champions recognizes historic figures who helped build our glorious province with special fields of fame monuments at various locations in the city , with more to come , and Project Kickstart helps immigrants looking for work to find it , often through Hoffman 's incredible network of friends and acquaintances that he 's never afraid to call on to help another person in need .
reworded: All of this effort is aimed at generating funds for Gordy and Eva Hoffman's three charities: Project Warmth, Alberta Champions (for full transparency, I serve on the board), and Operation Kickstart. This year, Project Warmth plans to provide over 85,000 gently used and cleaned coats, hats, and gloves to children in need. Alberta Champions honors historical figures who contributed to the development of our wonderful province by establishing special fields of fame monuments at various city locations, with more planned for the future. Meanwhile, Operation Kickstart assists immigrants in finding employment, often leveraging Hoffman’s extensive network of friends and contacts, whom he readily calls upon to support those in need.

text: In each and every town or city where a Caxton local paper is distributed , you will find them immersed in their communities , providing assistance with projects that uplift society . A stand-out community newspaper initiative is DICE ( Do I Care Enough ) , a vital component of the Zululand Observer , indelibly linked to Zululand since 1973 . Not only is it involved in the care of the vulnerable and dispossessed , but it is active in all spheres of community upliftment wherever the need may be .
reworded: In every town or city where a Caxton local paper is available, you will find them deeply engaged in their communities, supporting initiatives that enhance society. text: He was born HIV-positive . He 's healthy , but when Sasha met him , volunteering at an orphanage , he weighed half as much as a 3&#xBD ; year-old boy should , and his hair was falling out . The only word he knew was Russian for " Do n't do that . " The nurses told Sasha not to touch him . Not because of the HIV . It was love they were concerned with . If he received any , he 'd want more , and none would be forthcoming . He was aging out of the ward , and now they were going to send him to another one , more hopeless still , where he would be thrown in with lost causes of all ages . And there he would remain , as long as he remained .
reworded: He was born with HIV. Although he is healthy now, when Sasha encountered him while volunteering at an orphanage, he weighed only half of what a 3½-year-old boy should, and his hair was thinning. The only phrase he knew was the Russian equivalent of "Don't do that." The nurses advised Sasha against touching him, not due to the HIV, but out of concern for his emotional well-being. They feared that if he experienced any affection, he would crave more, which they could not provide. He was nearing the age limit for the ward, and they planned to transfer him to a more desolate place, where he would be grouped with others deemed hopeless, and he would likely remain there indefinitely.

text: The story of Christmas although ancient is always made new -- " how God became flesh and lived among us , to be like us in all things but sin ... to be " Emmanuel " reminding men and women that God is with us at all times . Our welcoming Jesus this Christmas is to highlight that Jesus is the " Unconquered Son of Justice " who come to dispel the darkness of the world held captive by sin and ignorance . His coming tells us that He made Himself human to be one of us , to bring His love to all of us , especially the poor , the orphan , sick , disabled , and the oppressed .
reworded: The tale of Christmas, though rooted in history, is continually refreshed—"how God took on human form and dwelled among us, sharing in our experiences except for sin... to be 'Emmanuel,' a reminder that God is always present with us. By welcoming Jesus this Christmas, we emphasize that He is the 'Unconquered Son of Justice,' who came to illuminate the darkness that sin and ignorance have cast over the world. His arrival signifies that He chose to become human to connect with us, sharing His love with everyone, particularly the poor, orphans, the sick, the disabled, and the oppressed."

text: At Davos , the World Economic Forum dedicated this year to cultivate " responsive " and " responsible " leadership in a world largely lacking both . This mission obviously refers to domestic/national leaders , who must now serve as the bastion of bringing a torn and submerging planet from disaster , whether caused by over-adrenalised presidents and prime ministers , or environmental decay , damage , and neglect , or something else . Clearly , many would be needed , for example , to heal the Syrian scars , home the burgeoning refugee/migrant influxes , and heed the U.N . SDG ( Sustainable Development Goals ) mandate to uplift the deprived , minorities , unschooled children , other suppressed women , and so forth .
reworded: At this year’s World Economic Forum in Davos, the focus was on fostering "responsive" and "responsible" leadership in a world that is largely devoid of both. This initiative clearly pertains to national leaders, who must now act as the guardians of a planet that is fragmented and at risk of disaster, whether due to overly aggressive political figures, environmental degradation, or other factors. It is evident that many leaders will be required to address issues such as healing the wounds of Syria, accommodating the increasing influx of refugees and migrants, and adhering to the U.N. Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to uplift the underprivileged, minorities, uneducated children, and marginalized women, among others.

text: I find it ironic to believe that in a well developed country like the U.K child benefits is offered to every child plus free education , school trips . Ghana on the other hand , an under developed country has no child benefits system for its children , or housing benefit and I write some children to date are being educated under the trees in this 21st century Ghana . For example , the child benefit was introduced in Britain in 1798 and later stopped but reintroduced in 1909 . How could our system help poor families to help with Ghana economy ? What is stopping Ghana in addressing poverty within families and emulating this forward thinking attributes of British in eradicate child poverty . This approach from make a difference and give children and families a better chance in life .
reworded: I find it quite ironic that in a developed nation like the U.K., child benefits are provided for every child, along with free education and school trips. In contrast, Ghana, which is still developing, lacks a child benefits system for its youth and does not offer housing assistance. It's disheartening to note that even in this 21st century, some children in Ghana are being educated under trees. For instance, child benefits were first introduced in Britain in 1798, briefly halted, and then reestablished in 1909. How can our system support impoverished families and contribute to Ghana's economy? What barriers are preventing Ghana from tackling family poverty and adopting the progressive measures seen in Britain to eliminate child poverty? This kind of approach could truly make a difference, providing children and families with better opportunities in life.

text: It is encouraging to note that the poor families all over India now realise that the best that they can do for their children is to provide them quality education , that would enable them to equip themselves to improve their life prospects . reworded: It is heartening to see that families in poverty across India are beginning to understand that the most beneficial thing they can do for their children is to provide them with a quality education, which will help them enhance their future opportunities. Despite their challenging circumstances and daily struggles to make ends meet, parents are doing their best to monitor their children's academic progress in school.

text: " The commitment of Christians in this field is as urgent today as in the past . Just look at the past century , we remember the wonderful figure of St. Frances Cabrini , who dedicated her life together with her companions to migrants to the United States of America . Today too we need similar witness so that mercy can reach many in need . It is a commitment that involves everyone , without exception . Dioceses , parishes , institutes of consecrated life , associations and movements , as well as individual Christians , we are called to welcome the brothers and sisters fleeing war , famine , violence and inhumane living conditions . All together we are a great strength of support for those who have lost home , family , work and dignity . "
reworded: The dedication of Christians in this area is just as crucial today as it has been in the past. Reflecting on the last century, we recall the remarkable figure of St. Frances Cabrini, who devoted her life alongside her companions to assisting migrants in the United States. We still need similar examples today to ensure that mercy reaches those in need. This commitment calls for the involvement of everyone, without exception. Dioceses, parishes, religious institutes, associations, movements, and individual Christians are all invited to welcome those fleeing from war, famine, violence, and inhumane living conditions. Together, we form a powerful support system for those who have lost their homes, families, jobs, and dignity.

text: Most people around the world live in cities for work , but all too often these places leave people feeling trapped , unable to live life on their own terms and disconnected from their communities . Traffic ; lack of transport alternatives ; legacy infrastructure ; inadequate stadia and facilities ; restricted education choices ; poor access to health care ; unaffordable housing and time-poor families , are all cited as unattractive contributions to life in big cities .
reworded: Many individuals worldwide reside in urban areas for employment, yet these environments often leave them feeling confined, unable to live life on their own terms, and disconnected from their communities. Issues such as traffic congestion, a lack of transportation options, outdated infrastructure, insufficient sports facilities, limited educational opportunities, poor healthcare access, high housing costs, and busy families are frequently mentioned as negative aspects of urban living.

text: There were many astonishing survival tales : a newspaper report from Douglas Wilkie , The Sunday Sun 's correspondent in India , reported that " stories of epic courage and pitiful tragedy are accumulating as parties of gaunt and haggard refugees from Burma still struggle into Northern Assam " . A blind Indian was led all the way by his two small sons ; a crippled man shouldered a spare wooden leg throughout the entire journey , " lest he smashed the other on a rock " ; a woman , " exhausted , her feet worn to bone " , crawled the last 22 miles . More cheerfully , a pet spaniel thought to have fallen over a cliff was brought in days later by a Gurkha soldier -- with a healthy litter of puppies .
reworded: There are numerous remarkable survival stories: a report by Douglas Wilkie, The Sunday Sun's correspondent in India, noted that "tales of extraordinary bravery and heartbreaking tragedy are piling up as groups of gaunt and weary refugees from Burma continue to arrive in Northern Assam." One blind Indian was guided the entire way by his two young sons; a disabled man carried a spare wooden leg throughout the journey, "to avoid breaking the other on a rock"; a woman, "exhausted, with her feet worn to the bone," crawled the final 22 miles. In a more uplifting twist, a pet spaniel, presumed to have fallen off a cliff, was later brought back by a Gurkha soldier—along with a healthy litter of puppies.

text: Rio 2016 produced many memorable moments . The inclusion of a refugee team was a first -- and a great initiative ; swimmers like Yusra Mardini and Ramis Anis may not have won medals but they certainly seemed to have won the hearts of spectators . Then there was the magic of 19-year old American Simone Biles ' gymnastics and the thrill of the track as Usain Bolt flew over the finish line -- again . Sporting heroes bowed out from the Olympic stage , young competitors stepped forward with thrilling performances .
reworded: The Rio 2016 Olympics offered numerous unforgettable moments. The introduction of a refugee team was a groundbreaking and commendable initiative; athletes like Yusra Mardini and Ramis Anis may not have secured medals, but they undoubtedly captured the admiration of the audience. Additionally, the enchanting performances of 19-year-old American gymnast Simone Biles and Usain Bolt's exhilarating dash to the finish line—once again—added to the excitement. As some sporting legends bid farewell to the Olympic arena, emerging young athletes showcased their remarkable talents.

text: The capitalism of our time does not understand the value of the union , because it has forgotten the social nature of the economy , enterprise , life , ties and patents . But perhaps our society does not understand the union because it does not see it fight enough in the ' not yet ' rights places : in the existential suburbs , among the discarded laborers , among the immigrants , the poor who are under the city walls ; Or simply it does not understand why corruption has sometimes entered the heart of some trade unionists . Do not let this be blocked . "
reworded: The capitalism we experience today fails to recognize the significance of unions, having lost sight of the economy's social dimensions, as well as the importance of community, enterprise, relationships, and rights. However, it may be that society struggles to grasp the concept of union because it does not witness enough advocacy for rights in the 'not yet' spaces: in marginalized neighborhoods, among discarded workers, immigrants, and the impoverished living on the outskirts of cities. Alternatively, there might be a lack of understanding regarding the instances where corruption has infiltrated the ranks of some union leaders. We must not allow this to be overlooked.

text: Relief programmes are being scaled up to meet rising needs , but to save lives and prevent decades of development progress from being irreversibly eroded , more must be done . We need to provide more people with desperately needed cash and food assistance . We need to reach more children with specialised nutritional support to stop greater numbers from becoming malnourished . And we need to expand social safety nets that buffer the impact of this crisis , such as school feeding programmes so children from poor families get at least one good meal a day . The urgency of the situation is irrefutable . But humanitarian aid is not keeping pace with the tremendous needs . Not even close . In fact , there is a staggering funding gap -- and it is a tragedy in the making .
reworded: Relief programs are being expanded to address increasing demands, but to save lives and prevent irreversible setbacks in development, more action is necessary. We must provide additional cash and food assistance to those in dire need. It's crucial to extend specialized nutritional support to more children to prevent a rise in malnutrition. Additionally, we need to enhance social safety nets, like school feeding programs, to ensure that children from low-income families receive at least one nutritious meal each day. The urgency of the situation is undeniable. However, humanitarian aid is falling significantly short of the overwhelming needs. The funding gap is alarming and poses a looming tragedy.

text: What we have instead observed has been an ever-escalating education arms race , in which the poorest children have ended up hopelessly ill-equipped to fight . The signs are all around us : the booming billion-pound industry of private tutors paid to boost pupils ? ? ? grades ; the sharp-elbowed tiger parents stopping at nothing to get their children into the best schools , and the stressed-out students trying to navigate a complex and often baffling university admissions system .
reworded: What we have witnessed instead is a continuously intensifying competition in education, leaving the most disadvantaged children inadequately prepared to compete. The evidence is everywhere: the thriving billion-pound market for private tutors hired to enhance students' grades; the fiercely determined parents who will go to any lengths to secure their children’s admission to top schools; and the overwhelmed students trying to make sense of a complicated and often perplexing university admissions process.

text: The Central Market of Thessaloniki ( CMT ) is working on the launch of a project with Bulgarian organizations , which is meant to reduce the waste of fruits and vegetables . These volumes of produce are then redistributed to initiatives for the support of people in need , such as food banks . The project still has to be approved by the European Commission .
reworded: The Central Market of Thessaloniki (CMT) is initiating a project in collaboration with Bulgarian organizations aimed at minimizing the waste of fruits and vegetables. The project's objective is to gather fresh produce that, while unsuitable for sale, is still perfectly safe for consumption. This surplus will then be redistributed to support initiatives for those in need, such as food banks. However, the project is still pending approval from the European Commission.

text: Christian missionaries care for the destitute , and Jain sects serve and feed the disabled . Islamic traditions require setting aside a regular fraction of one 's earnings to feed the hungry and destitute . I find in Muslim ghettoes of Delhi like Nizamuddin and Jama Masjid , even today , a number of wayside eateries that offer plastic tokens for sale . These are bought by people who eat at the restaurants , and they distribute these to destitute people . Each token can be redeemed by them for a meal , when they are in need of food , over a period of a month .
reworded: Christian missionaries provide assistance to the impoverished, while Jain communities offer support and meals to those with disabilities. Islamic customs mandate that a portion of one’s income be allocated to feed the hungry and needy. In the Muslim neighborhoods of Delhi, such as Nizamuddin and Jama Masjid, there are still many roadside eateries today that sell plastic tokens. Diners purchase these tokens and give them to those in need. Each token can be exchanged for a meal over the course of a month when the recipients require food.

text: The AIMMM registers its full sympathy with the hapless female victims of violence and rape crimes , especially the young lady brutalised by beasts on a moving Delhi bus in the night of 16 December which has rightly agitated a large section of Indians . All such crimes against women and weaker sections , especially minorities , Dalits and Adivasis are highly condemnable and show the whole country in extremely bad light . It is time people , police , judiciary and government agencies stood up to discharge their duties to protect the weak and vulnerable sections of society . The AIMMM urges the government to introduce deterrent punishments for such brutal crimes . It should also hasten with the overdue Police reforms to liberate the police force from the British Raj rules and make it capable and accountable to protect all citizens , human rights and honour of ordinary people .
reworded: The AIMMM expresses its deep sympathy for the unfortunate female victims of violence and sexual assault, particularly the young woman who was brutally attacked by assailants on a moving bus in Delhi on the night of December 16, an incident that has justifiably outraged many Indians. Such acts of violence against women and marginalized groups, including minorities, Dalits, and Adivasis, are utterly reprehensible and reflect poorly on our nation. It is imperative that the public, law enforcement, the judiciary, and government bodies fulfill their responsibilities to safeguard the weak and vulnerable members of society. The AIMMM calls on the government to implement strict penalties for these horrific crimes. Additionally, it urges the swift enactment of necessary police reforms to free the police force from colonial-era regulations and to ensure it is equipped and accountable to protect the rights and dignity of all citizens.

text: IrishCentral is live from the International Commemoration of Ireland 's Great Hunger on the grounds of the NYC Marine Hospital Quarantine Cemetery on Staten Island . Thousands of Irish immigrants who fled Ireland during the Great Hunger of 1845-1852 are buried here . They died at the gateway to America , never realizing the dream of a new life . This event is held by the Friends of Abandoned Cemeteries of Staten Island ( FACSI ) . Read more about the site 's history here : http : //bit.ly/2qL25mv
reworded: IrishCentral is broadcasting live from the International Commemoration of Ireland's Great Hunger, taking place at the NYC Marine Hospital Quarantine Cemetery on Staten Island. This site is the final resting place for thousands of Irish immigrants who escaped Ireland during the Great Hunger of 1845-1852, only to perish at the threshold of America, never achieving their dream of a new life. The event is organized by the Friends of Abandoned Cemeteries of Staten Island (FACSI). To learn more about the history of this location, visit: http://bit.ly/2qL25mv.

text: This aspect of the Constitution has required the Court on several occasions to assess policy adopted by the government . In the seminal early case , Government of the RSA and Others v Grootboom and Others , 49 the Court held that the government 's housing policy was in breach of the obligations imposed upon government by section 26 of the Constitution in that it failed to " provide for any form of relief to those desperately in need of access to housing " 50 and ordered the government to to amend its program " to provide relief for people who have no access to land , no roof over their heads , and who are living in intolerable conditions or crisis situations . " 51
reworded: This element of the Constitution has compelled the Court to evaluate government policies on multiple occasions. In the landmark case, Government of the RSA and Others v Grootboom and Others, the Court determined that the government's housing policy violated the obligations set forth in section 26 of the Constitution, as it did not "provide any form of relief to those urgently in need of housing." Consequently, the Court mandated the government to revise its program "to offer assistance to individuals lacking access to land, without shelter, and living in dire conditions or crises."

text: Our judicial system works , we have a free press , a wonderful , best in the world Constitution , and our Press is free . We must be very grateful for these huge benefits . The blacks want all our farmland without compensation . Give it to them . Let the farmers flock into the cities and make a new life for themselves . With their resilience I am sure it will not be so difficult for them to establish a new , happy and productive life . They will have no money but the clothes on their back to start off with , but that is what so many immigrant Americans had to face . Through guts , determination and sheer will power , they rose above it all , and look what America is today .
reworded: Our legal system functions effectively, we enjoy a free press, and we have an exceptional Constitution that is among the best globally. We should be immensely thankful for these significant advantages. The black community seeks to acquire all our farmland without compensation. Let’s grant it to them. This will encourage farmers to move to the cities and create new lives for themselves. Given their resilience, I am confident they will find it manageable to build a new, joyful, and productive existence. They may start with little more than the clothes on their backs, but many immigrant Americans faced similar challenges. Through courage, determination, and sheer will, they overcame those obstacles, and look at what America has become today.

text: Thus , the education -- labour market connection is characterised by a vicious circle whereby poor children obtain poor quality education , which in turn limits their participation in the economy and obstructs the next generation 's efforts to get a good education . Our research has identified low-quality education as the main poverty trap holding back upward mobility of children from poor families .
reworded: Consequently, the link between education and the labor market is marked by a detrimental cycle where disadvantaged children receive subpar education, which subsequently restricts their economic participation and hinders the educational opportunities for the next generation. Our study has pinpointed inadequate education as the primary poverty trap that impedes the upward mobility of children from low-income families.

text: Although policy change is needed in the early childhood development sector in South Africa , the first step is a change in mind-set . When one sees the conditions in which the children of poor families learn , it is clear that we do not value poor black children . Their lives and their future prospects are not valued in the way they should be . Additionally , we also need to recognise the importance of the first few years of a child 's life . This is a period of rapid brain development , which is greater than at any other time of a person 's life . Moreover , not only do the early experiences of a child shape their lifelong learning , it also affects their physical and mental health .
reworded: While a shift in policy is essential for the early childhood development sector in South Africa, the initial step is to change our mindset. Observing the conditions in which children from impoverished families learn makes it evident that we do not value poor black children adequately. Their lives and future opportunities are not appreciated as they should be. Furthermore, we must acknowledge the significance of the early years in a child's life. This is a time of rapid brain development, more intense than at any other stage in life. Additionally, a child's early experiences not only influence their lifelong learning but also have a profound impact on their physical and mental well-being.

text: While the future of the peace process remains uncertain , the hard fact that the government must tackle now is to not just take back the " failed " refugees but also ensure that they are not devoured by the same demon they had fled from in the first instance .
reworded: Although the future of the peace process is still unclear, the government faces a pressing reality: it must not only bring back the "failed" refugees but also ensure they are not once again confronted by the same threats they initially escaped.

text: An immigrant to a developed country lives in two worlds . In the metropolitan societies he encounters a different way of looking at things . He develops new ideas , gains a new confidence . In the new country there are opportunities , he gets accustomed to a good standard of living . Yet he is an outsider , not fully assimilated , ethnicity and culture sets him apart from the mainstream . He yearns for familiarity , his roots . The idea of retiring to the original country comes to him .
reworded: An immigrant in a developed country navigates two distinct worlds. In urban environments, he encounters a fresh perspective on life, which inspires new ideas and boosts his confidence. The new country offers various opportunities, and he becomes accustomed to an improved standard of living. However, he remains an outsider, not fully integrated, as his ethnicity and culture differentiate him from the dominant society. He longs for the comfort of familiarity and his origins, leading him to contemplate the possibility of retiring back to his home country.

text: The spirit the Rwandese have shown to accommodate the people , almost a tribe in their tiny country with approximately 19 million people with meager resources just like any other third world country , without planning to ditch them in refugee camps , but offer them to live just like any other citizen should actually be emulated in the human race .
reworded: The generosity displayed by the Rwandan people in welcoming those from various backgrounds into their small nation, which has around 19 million inhabitants and limited resources typical of many developing countries, is commendable. Rather than relegating them to refugee camps, they allow them to live as any other citizen would. This approach is truly a model for humanity to follow.

text: They care for our children , elderly , disabled , and homes , but are we doing enough to take care of them ?
reworded: They look after our children, the elderly, the disabled, and our homes, but are we doing enough to support them in return?

text: " When you donate to a charity like that , in your mind you think you 're helping kids and poor families have a Christmas . reworded: "When you contribute to a charity like that, you believe you’re helping children and low-income families enjoy a Christmas. You don’t realize that your donations are actually funding Sunshine Bags for inmates," stated a veteran prison guard at Ontario's Fenbrook Institution, where approximately 450 inmates will receive the bags on Thursday.

text: When politicians discuss immigration , it is usually in high-flying terms . Jeb Bush says that " immigrants create an engine of economic prosperity . reworded: When politicians talk about immigration, they often use grandiose language. Jeb Bush claims that "immigrants drive an engine of economic prosperity." Leaders frequently emphasize the importance of attracting the most talented individuals from other countries. However, the reality of illegal immigration, as observed in New York City's social circles, reveals a grim situation where lawlessness prevails, allowing for the mistreatment of individuals with minimal repercussions.

text: Lilia Caberio is from Sulangan , in the Philippines . In 2013 , her house was destroyed by the 170 mile per hour winds and 6-metre high storm surge during Typhoon Haiyan , and for a while she lived with her family in a tent erected where her home used to be . The typhoon was frightening enough for Lilia , but homelessness must have felt even more so . Until Elizabeth came along .
reworded: Lilia Caberio hails from Sulangan in the Philippines. In 2013, her home was devastated by the powerful winds of Typhoon Haiyan, which reached speeds of 170 miles per hour, along with a storm surge that was 6 meters high. For a time, she and her family lived in a tent set up where their house once stood. While the typhoon was terrifying for Lilia, the experience of being homeless must have been even more daunting—until Elizabeth arrived.

text: I think the living wage will help share around the spoils of globalisation a little more evenly . Cutting of the flow of immigrants will not solve the problem ( with effective full employment we need them ) but paying the poor/low skilled a decent wage may help to reduce the resentment they feel for so many things ( elites , government , EU , foreigners , immigrants ) .
reworded: I believe that implementing a living wage will help distribute the benefits of globalization more fairly. Simply restricting immigration won't address the issue—given that we need immigrants for effective full employment—but providing a fair wage to low-skilled workers could alleviate some of the resentment they harbor towards various entities such as the elites, government, EU, foreigners, and immigrants.

text: As Maas put it , " the loss of this organisation could unleash an uncontrollable chain reaction . " Kids would be pushed from UNRWA classrooms onto the streets , where they would be more vulnerable to dangerous scenarios such as recruitment efforts by terrorists , who will surely jump at the chance to argue that if we ca n't keep our aid promises , peaceful coexistence with the West is impossible . Child marriage , child labour , and child trafficking would rise . A generation of children and young people would be lost , in a region more unstable than ever .
reworded: As Maas stated, "the dissolution of this organization could trigger an uncontrollable chain reaction." Children would be forced out of UNRWA classrooms and onto the streets, making them more susceptible to perilous situations, such as being targeted for recruitment by terrorists who would undoubtedly seize the opportunity to argue that if we fail to uphold our aid commitments, peaceful coexistence with the West is unattainable. There would be an increase in child marriage, child labor, and child trafficking. A generation of children and young people would be lost in a region that is already more unstable than ever.

text: The 19th century figure of misfortune is conjured from the smokey dark of industrial Leicester as a young boy who 's drunken father pleads with him to be in the world but not of it -- to tow the line and appear the same as everyone else . Our Elephant Man does n't bear the growths and deformities of his historical predecessor , but Daniel Monks is physically disabled , lending so much more gravitas to the tale . He journeys from beneath the comfort of his mother 's wing , to the hostile streets , to the freak show , until even the tout rejects him because he " makes an art form out of loneliness " .
reworded: The 19th-century embodiment of misfortune emerges from the smoky shadows of industrial Leicester as a young boy whose inebriated father implores him to exist in the world without truly being part of it—urging him to conform and blend in with everyone else. Our Elephant Man does not exhibit the physical growths and deformities of his historical counterpart, but Daniel Monks, who has a physical disability, adds significant depth to the narrative. He transitions from the safety of his mother’s care to the unforgiving streets and into the freak show, only to be rejected even by the tout for "making an art form out of loneliness."

text: For her unwavering commitment to aiding those most in need , Mother Teresa stands out as one of the greatest humanitarians of the 20th century . She combined profound empathy and a fervent commitment to her cause with incredible organizational and managerial skills that allowed her to develop a vast and effective international organization of missionaries to help impoverished citizens all across the globe .
reworded: Due to her steadfast dedication to helping those in greatest need, Mother Teresa is recognized as one of the most remarkable humanitarians of the 20th century. She blended deep compassion and a passionate commitment to her mission with exceptional organizational and management abilities, enabling her to establish a large and effective international network of missionaries to assist impoverished individuals worldwide.

text: Yong is not the first Sabahan to find himself on the wrong side of the law , and neither will he be the last . Lee , too , came from a family facing hard times ; his mother a bankrupt , his father in need of an operation after a heart attack . As the only child and sole breadwinner , he agreed to deliver packages in Malaysia and Singapore . The packages turned out to be heroin . Yong told his lawyer that in 2009 Lee was dragged kicking and screaming from his cell to the gallows .
reworded: Yong is not the first individual from Sabah to find himself in legal trouble, nor will he be the last. Another young man from Sabah, Lee Siaw Foo, was sentenced for trafficking heroin into Singapore. Like Yong, Lee came from a struggling family; his mother was bankrupt, and his father required surgery following a heart attack. As the only child and primary provider, he agreed to transport packages between Malaysia and Singapore, which turned out to contain heroin. Yong recounted to his lawyer that in 2009, Lee was forcibly taken from his cell to the gallows, fighting and screaming.

text: Saint Teresa spent her life emptying the Indian streets of the maimed , the needy , the indigent , the dying . reworded: Saint Teresa dedicated her life to clearing the streets of India of the injured, the needy, the impoverished, and the dying. They rally their supporters to occupy every sidewalk, road, and highway between Islamabad and Lahore, demanding his resignation or removal.

text: What they fail to understand is that education is that when you educated a man , you educate a man , but when you educate a woman , you educated a whole generation . text: Ryan says he plans to serve out the remainder of his term , so he may have the opportunity to add to his legacy . Last October , following the mass shooting in Las Vegas , Ryan said he would " look into " the banning of bump stocks . There 's also the matter of the 800,000 " Dreamers " -- undocumented immigrants who were brought into the country as children who were protected under the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals ( DACA ) program , which Trump ended . Last September , Ryan told those affected by the rescinding of DACA to " rest easy , " as Congress would take action to allow them to stay in the country . No such bill has passed Congress yet .
reworded: Ryan has stated his intention to complete the rest of his term, which may allow him to enhance his legacy. Following the tragic mass shooting in Las Vegas last October, he mentioned he would "look into" the possibility of banning bump stocks. Additionally, there is the issue of the 800,000 "Dreamers"—undocumented immigrants who were brought to the U.S. as children and were protected under the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program, which was terminated by Trump. Last September, Ryan reassured those affected by the DACA repeal to "rest easy," promising that Congress would take steps to allow them to remain in the country. However, no legislation has been passed by Congress to date.

text: Bhopal : A day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched 21 electronic mandis across the country to help farmers sell their produce online and do away with middlemen , Madhya Pradesh chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan was distributing tomatoes free of cost to poor families in Vidisha , as prices crashed to all-time low , Rs 2 a kg , not enough to recover the sowing cost . Not only the tomatoes , wholesale price of onions too have plumetted to 20 to 30 paise a kg , almost negligible , in several districts including Vidisha , Neemuch and Mandsaur , where farmers can not afford even transportation cost .
reworded: Bhopal: A day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated 21 electronic mandis nationwide to assist farmers in selling their crops online and eliminate middlemen, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan was distributing tomatoes for free to impoverished families in Vidisha, as prices plummeted to an unprecedented low of Rs 2 per kg, insufficient to cover planting costs. In addition to tomatoes, the wholesale price of onions has also dropped to between 20 to 30 paise per kg in various districts, including Vidisha, Neemuch, and Mandsaur, leaving farmers unable to even afford transportation.

reworded: They make an average of Rs 12,000 each month, which doesn’t classify them as 'highly paid' by any measure. text: Every day , tons of excess food -- mostly bread and vegetables -- were discarded , and would have gone to waste , were it not for the intervention of one man . reworded: Every day, vast amounts of surplus food—primarily bread and vegetables—were thrown away and would have gone to waste if not for the efforts of one individual. Massimo Bottura, the head chef of the three-Michelin-star restaurant Osteria Francescana in Modena, created an innovative project to channel this food to those in greatest need in a creative and inspiring manner that would leave a lasting impression on everyone involved.

text: Since the publication of the book , I have been stunned to hear from so many people who have suffered the degradation of homelessness . I remember one particularly heartbreaking account from a woman who was living in a car with her daughter . I received so many stories from men and women of all ages that I wondered how far we have left our judgmental attitude behind . Because when we elevate our compassion , it leads to action to solve the problem .
reworded: Since the release of the book, I have been amazed by the number of individuals who have reached out to share their experiences with the harsh reality of homelessness. One story that particularly moved me was from a woman who was living in her car with her daughter. I've received countless narratives from people of various ages, leading me to question how much we have truly moved past our judgmental views. When we enhance our compassion, it inspires us to take action to address the issue.

text: In the midst of all these alignments and repositioning , the mass of Nigerians have remained poor , unhealthy , uneducated , unemployed , homeless , hungry , destitute and abandoned . However, many Muslim women and girls, especially those from underprivileged backgrounds, are stepping forward to illuminate the path of knowledge and create a brighter future for the next generation. text: It was about noon . The heat from the afternoon sun baked Oshodi with intensity , and perspiration ran down the cheeks of the folks plying their trade in the chaotic commercial environment . Meet Seun Fola ? jin , a 17-year-old homeless teenager who has been living underneath the bridge at Oshodi since 2011 .
reworded: It was around noon. The afternoon sun beat down on Oshodi with fierce intensity, causing sweat to trickle down the faces of those engaged in their bustling trades. A young teenager perched on a fence near the main road. At that moment, many of his friends would be in school, but he was out in the sweltering heat, striving to make a living. He was eagerly waiting for a commercial driver to hire him for the day. Meet Seun Fola? jin, a 17-year-old homeless youth who has been living under the bridge at Oshodi since 2011.

text: Mr. Mathur , who was born in India , came to Canada in the early Seventies when he was eight years old . His hard-working immigrant parents inspired him always to be resilient , as they demonstrated by gamely facing the hardships of integrating into society , finding work and putting food on the table . He describes his upbringing as somewhat spiritual , first in downtown Toronto and then in Bramalea , north-west of Toronto , in a working-class area filled with young families where " it seemed everyone was the same , " with the kids focused on academia and sports .
reworded: Mr. Mathur, who hails from India, moved to Canada in the early Seventies at the age of eight. His diligent immigrant parents instilled in him the importance of resilience, as they bravely navigated the challenges of adapting to a new society, securing employment, and providing for their family. He characterizes his childhood as somewhat spiritual, first living in downtown Toronto and later in Bramalea, a working-class neighborhood northwest of Toronto filled with young families where "everyone seemed similar," with children concentrating on their studies and sports.

text: So , it is the poor , mostly Muslim countries which are helping the refugees and the displaced poor . If we think we are going to gain eternal life without passing the test that Jesus of Nazareth gives to end hunger , release innocent prisoners , cloth the naked and feed the hungry ( Matthew 25 ) and work for justice and love of neighbor -- we are mistaken . What greater way is there to live than to live for others and not for self .
reworded: It is primarily the impoverished, predominantly Muslim nations that are stepping up to assist refugees and the destitute. If we believe we can attain eternal life without undergoing the trials set forth by Jesus of Nazareth—such as ending hunger, freeing innocent captives, clothing the naked, feeding the hungry (Matthew 25), and striving for justice and love for our neighbors—we are mistaken. There is no greater way to live than to dedicate oneself to the well-being of others rather than focusing solely on oneself.

reworded: The Interact Club is a service-oriented organization dedicated to the principle of "Service before self." Mahatma Gandhi once stated, "You must be the change you wish to see in the world." The Interact Club offers you the chance to embody this change. It focuses on community service, helping those in need, and being part of a transformation that brings joy to both yourself and others. The Installation Ceremony for the Office Bearers of the Interact Club of Wycherley for the academic year 2010-2011 took place at the High School Campus on Queen's Road towards the end of last year.

text: In South Africa , education is a right and not a privilege , but an unfavourable background can unconsciously infringe on this right . It is well-known that poverty is widespread in our nation, which means that those who are more fortunate should lend a helping hand to those in need. It may seem like an exaggeration, but many girls from impoverished families miss school because they cannot afford sanitary pads.

text: This all seems very theoretical but in short it lies at the very heart of the current discussion about migration and refugees across Europe . If people cannotearn enough to live a decent life in their own country then it is inevitable that many will attempt to move to places where the lowest paid job offers more hope than is possible in their own home .
reworded: This may sound quite theoretical, but it is fundamentally central to the ongoing conversation about migration and refugees in Europe. If individuals are unable to earn a sufficient income to lead a respectable life in their own countries, it is only natural that many will seek to relocate to areas where even the lowest-paying jobs offer more promise than what they can find at home.

text: That is not all . Regarding the quality of life as contained in the Millennium Development Goals , such as access to health care , potable water , electricity and reliable infrastructure , the country went from bad to worse . A veritable underclass of desperately poor people , some derelict and homeless was the underside of increased growth and expansion of the millionaire class brandishing private jets . Add to this depressing scenario , our recent economic convulsions manifested in worsening unemployment , upward spiral in the inflation rate , the abasement of the salaried elite caught in a debacle of lengthening defaults , the virtual wiping out of small scale businesses , and you get a social explosion waiting to happen .
reworded: That’s not all. In terms of quality of life as outlined in the Millennium Development Goals—such as access to healthcare, clean water, electricity, and dependable infrastructure—the situation in the country has deteriorated significantly. A true underclass of extremely impoverished individuals, some of whom are homeless and abandoned, has emerged alongside the rising wealth of a millionaire class flaunting private jets. To add to this grim picture, our recent economic turmoil has led to increasing unemployment, a rising inflation rate, the degradation of the salaried elite facing prolonged defaults, and the near destruction of small businesses, creating a recipe for a potential social upheaval.

text: Whenever the term ' disabled ' is mentioned , it becomes the general perception that one is completely crippled or bedridden , and dis-abled are judged as being completely hopeless and unable to fend for themselves . Disability is known to be caused by impairments of several subsystems of the human body . Disabled people can suffer from visual impairment , physical impairment , intellectual impairment , mental illness and other several types of chronic disease .
reworded: Whenever the word 'disabled' is used, it often leads to the common assumption that the individual is entirely incapacitated or confined to bed, and those with disabilities are viewed as completely helpless and unable to care for themselves. Disabilities can arise from various impairments affecting different systems within the human body. Individuals with disabilities may experience issues such as visual impairment, physical limitations, intellectual challenges, mental health conditions, and various chronic illnesses.

text: First of all , while , of course , it is the individual who directly benefits from college education in terms of acquiring more knowledge and skills , which translates to more job opportunities , it is not the individual alone who benefits . In a poor country such as the Philippines where wages are low and labor is cheap , the college education of a member of a family , especially for the poor , is their only way out of poverty . It is also the only way by which the future family of that same family member could break free from the quagmire of poverty that has enveloped his or her family for generations . It is about social mobility . And if more poor families break free from poverty , would that not reflect on the development of Philippine society ?
reworded: To begin with, while it is undoubtedly the individual who gains directly from a college education by acquiring additional knowledge and skills, leading to increased job prospects, they are not the sole beneficiaries. In a developing nation like the Philippines, where wages are low and labor is inexpensive, a family member's college education, particularly for those in poverty, serves as their primary escape from hardship. It also represents the only opportunity for that individual’s future family to break free from the cycle of poverty that has affected them for generations. This is a matter of social mobility. If more families in poverty manage to rise above their circumstances, wouldn’t that contribute positively to the advancement of Philippine society?

text: Remarkable too are the ways in which a childhood spent in Pakistan forced one to dispense with fatalistic views of the world and hopeless imaginations of the future . Lifetimes are spent under skies dotted with flying bullets , with threats to kidnap loved ones , and in the thick of crowded markets that unexpectedly explode . Even amid the looming dangers , we knew there were other lives to be lived . And so we went on , fiercely living -- despite the noise in the background .
reworded: Equally impressive are the ways in which growing up in Pakistan compelled one to abandon fatalistic perspectives and bleak visions of the future. Lives are spent beneath skies filled with flying bullets, facing threats of kidnapping for loved ones, and navigating crowded markets that can suddenly erupt in violence. Yet, despite these ever-present dangers, we understood that there were other lives to be lived. Thus, we continued to live passionately—undeterred by the chaos surrounding us.

text: Yet they find a reason to keep their wealth out of reach . text: According to details , Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif accorded formal approval of the Rs 105.01 million as compensation including Rs 39 million meant for 39 martyrs , 25.6 million for 129 seriously injured/disabled persons , Rs 36.5 million for 73 partially and Rs 4 million will be given for four completely damaged houses by Indian shelling , AJK government spokesperson/DG ISPR Raja Azhar Iqbal told Agency here on Thursday late night .
reworded: As reported, Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif has officially approved a compensation package totaling Rs 105.01 million. text: Many words have been written and said about the Mercy Sisters and their contribution at Alpha . text: -- In 2014 Make the Future showcased Pavegen 's innovative kinetic tiles which convert player 's footsteps into energy for lightingfootball pitches in Rio 's Morro de Mineira favela and Lagos Nigeria . This was followed by 2016 's " Best Day of My Life " initiative which featured some of the world 's top singers to introduce other bright energy idea collaborations . An energy relay began in Kenya , where Shell supported the launch of GravityLight , an invention which brings clean light to off-grid Kenyan homes . This was followed by an initiative in Brazil , where Shell helped Insolar bring affordable solar solutions to communities in need in Rio .
reworded: In 2014, Make the Future highlighted Pavegen's groundbreaking kinetic tiles that transform players' footsteps into energy to illuminate football pitches in Rio's Morro de Mineira favela and Lagos, Nigeria. This was succeeded by the 2016 initiative "Best Day of My Life," which featured some of the world's leading artists to promote additional innovative energy collaborations. An energy relay commenced in Kenya, where Shell supported the introduction of GravityLight, a device that provides clean lighting to off-grid homes in Kenya. This was followed by a project in Brazil, where Shell assisted Insolar in delivering affordable solar solutions to underserved communities in Rio.

text: The RDA 's actions , whilst creating a stir in Colombo society , are symptomatic of a much deeper national issue that mostly affects poor and vulnerable citizens . reworded: The actions of the RDA, while causing a commotion in Colombo society, reflect a deeper national problem that predominantly impacts the poor and marginalized. text: The climate accord to which the Philippines has set a goal of 70% carbon emission reduction by 2030 , depending on financial , technological , and capacity-building support , was made possible partly due to our country 's leadership role as chair of the Climate Vulnerable Forum that focused the attention of last year 's 21st Conference of Parties meeting in Paris on the plight of the poor and most vulnerable .
reworded: The climate agreement that the Philippines aims to achieve, targeting a 70% reduction in carbon emissions by 2030, is contingent upon support in terms of finance, technology, and capacity building. This goal was made feasible in part due to our country's leadership as the chair of the Climate Vulnerable Forum, which highlighted the struggles of the impoverished and most vulnerable during last year’s 21st Conference of Parties meeting in Paris.

text: Most are from desperately poor Horn of Africa countries and like tens of thousands each year , were willing to risk the treacherous journey through war-torn and impoverished Yemen in the hope of finding work in Saudi Arabia and other wealthy Gulf Arab states . But their plan was not to be . Caught and detained by the Yemeni authorities , the 600 or so men now await deportation , prevented from leaving their makeshift jail by armed soldiers . Conditions at the warehouse are growing increasingly desperate . Several days ago , the authorities stopped handing out food and basic supplies . " I came from Djibouti to work . They used to give us small amounts of food . If there is no food , we will die , " said one migrant who declined to give his name . " If there is no solution , they will deport us to our countries or get us out of here " , the man added . Yemen , the poorest country on the Arabian Peninsula , has long been a transit point for migrants and refugees from East Africa , many of whom are fleeing hunger and violence . The route was unsafe long before Yemen descended into all-out war in 2015 . Hundreds drown each year on the perilous sea journey , and those who make it face multiple risks , including death by " assault , extortion and abuse by criminal networks , as well as the hazards stemming from the war in Yemen itself " , according to UNHCR , the United Nations ' refugee agency . Despite these dangers , the number of migrants traveling across the Gulf of Aden and Red Sea to Yemen has been rising steadily , to 117,000 in 2016 from 92,000 in 2015 , according to UNHCR . Khaled al-Elwany , a local official who until recently oversaw the deportation of migrants back to their home countries , says up to 15,000 migrants are arrested at city checkpoints each month . Elwany says he was fired by the interior ministry for refusing to cooperate with a plan to relocate the center to a neighboring province and after authorities stopped food supplies . A ministry official told Reuters that the aim of the move to a new facility had been to improve conditions for the migrants while they await deportation . Saudi Arabia and a coalition of mostly Gulf Arab allies are fighting to restore Yemen 's exiled government to power and roll back the Iran-aligned Houthi movement . While the government nominally controls Aden and other southern areas , a budget crunch and rivalries with local armed groups mean its officials mostly reside abroad . State services and salaries have been hit hard by the chaos , and the African migrants appear to be a lower priority . The frightened men in the Aden warehouse , subsisting on bread bought with meager savings and washing their clothes in an rubbish-strewn outdoor space , are just the tip of the iceberg .
reworded: Many of these individuals come from extremely impoverished countries in the Horn of Africa and, like tens of thousands each year, were willing to undertake the perilous journey through war-ravaged and destitute Yemen in hopes of finding employment in Saudi Arabia and other affluent Gulf Arab nations. However, their plans have been thwarted. Approximately 600 men have been apprehended and are now in detention, unable to leave their makeshift prison due to armed guards. The conditions in the warehouse are deteriorating rapidly. A few days ago, the authorities ceased distributing food and essential supplies. "I came from Djibouti to find work. They used to provide us with small portions of food. Without food, we will perish," stated one migrant who preferred to remain anonymous. "If there is no resolution, they will either deport us back to our countries or remove us from here," he added. Yemen, the poorest nation on the Arabian Peninsula, has historically served as a transit point for migrants and refugees from East Africa, many of whom are escaping hunger and violence. The route was perilous even before Yemen plunged into full-scale war in 2015. Each year, hundreds drown during the dangerous sea crossing, and those who survive face numerous threats, including death from "assault

text: A year after typhoon Yolanda 's vicious onslaught in many parts of Eastern Visayas , millions still find themselves homeless , with survivors starting to lose hope of ever rebuilding their lives as they witness this administration 's bumbling efforts in speeding up rehabilitation . Many have leveled down their expectations at the kind of assistance they will ever receive from the national government , remarking that the number of those who perished have yet to be correctly determined and remembering how President BS had chafed at suggestions that the figure could reach 10,000 . Many of us can still clearly recall how the president downplayed the estimates to about 2,500 in his interview with CNN 's Christiane Amanpour .
reworded: A year after the devastating impact of typhoon Yolanda on various regions of Eastern Visayas, millions remain without homes, and survivors are beginning to lose hope of rebuilding their lives as they observe the government's clumsy attempts at rehabilitation. Many have lowered their expectations regarding the assistance they might receive from the national government, noting that the true death toll has yet to be accurately assessed and recalling how President BS reacted negatively to claims that the number could reach 10,000. Many of us still vividly remember how the president minimized the estimates to around 2,500 during his interview with CNN's Christiane Amanpour.

text: According to the data of the National Disaster Management Authority , 386 people were killed and 816 injured . Malar and Mashkai tehsils of Awaran were the worst hit . The NDMA confirms more than 32,000 houses were flattened out and more than 14,000 partially damaged . Unofficial sources claim that the digits are watered down . Numbers aside , death and devastation is certainly enormous . Life is still scrambling through the heaps of debris particularly in Awaran district . Countless people are still homeless taking shelter with their relatives and acquaintances in neighbouring Lasbela , Hub and other areas .
reworded: As reported by the National Disaster Management Authority, 386 individuals lost their lives and 816 were injured. The tehsils of Malar and Mashkai in Awaran were the most severely affected. The NDMA has confirmed that over 32,000 homes were completely destroyed, while more than 14,000 sustained partial damage. However, unofficial sources suggest that these figures may be understated. Regardless of the exact numbers, the scale of death and destruction is undeniably vast. Life continues to struggle amidst the rubble, especially in the Awaran district. Many people remain homeless, seeking refuge with relatives and friends in nearby areas such as Lasbela, Hub, and others.

text: We work as if everything depends on us , and pray as though everything depends on God . But He does more than we could ever do .
